result.execSummary:
The defendant Stacy M Deford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Stacy M Deford is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Stacy M Deford was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge

miscConds.notes: Bonds on all files to be applied to costs

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

judgments.dispoDesc: Defendant sentenced after probation was revoked
judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stacy M Deford

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Stacy M Deford in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that parties have received a copy of the revocation order.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant wants to proceed without counsel.  Court questions the defendant regarding the letter that she had sent to the court.  Defendant understands what is happening in court today.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant responds.
  Court finds waiver of counsel made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Atty Hendee asks that Ms. Deford be provided a copy of the revocation packet to look at.  
Clerk gives a copy to the defendant.  Court gives the defendant time to look over the packet.
Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Court orders 90 days in the Marquette County Jail with huber
Credit = 60 days
Good Time 
Any outstanding costs will still be owed.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 13, 2017 at 11:00 am.
to Judge Bult from Stacy Deford
Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Stacy M Deford in court with attorney Mark David Lawton.  Defendant Stacy M Deford in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM168, 15CM108 & 15CM135 tracking together:
Atty Gumz states defendant is on a probation hold not connected to these matters.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1 in 15CM168 and Ct. 2 in 15CM108.  All other charges to be dismissed along with 15CM135.
Atty Lawton agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1 in 15CM168 and Ct. 2 in 15CM108.  All other charges to be dismissed along with 15CM135.

Atty Lawton makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1 in 15CM168 & Ct. 2 in 15CM108:  Withhold Sentence; 2 years Probation with conditions:
15 days in the Marquette County Jail on Ct. 2 in 15CM108
Sentence to commence forthwith
Court Costs = $243.00 on each count
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge on each count

Ct. 2 in 15CM168 to be dismissed
Counts 1 & 3 in 15CM108 to be dismissed
15CM135 to be dismissed
Return date on October 20, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Stacy M Deford in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant may be looking into treatment court and he has provided counsel with the booklet.  Atty Lawton asks that this be rescheduled; the defendant is interested in Treatment Court.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for October 20, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Return date on August 18, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Stacy M Deford in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant now appears in court and Atty Lawton has already left the building.
BY THE COURT:  Warrant will not be issued based on the defendant appearing in court.
Cash bond will be reinstated.
Reset  Return date scheduled for August 18, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Mark D. Lawton in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear.  
Court notes that the defendant was in the courthouse this morning and she called this afternoon that she would be late for the hearing today.
Atty Lawton has an authorization to appear.

BY THE COURT:    Warrant will issue.  Cash bond to be forfieted.
BY THE COURT:  Defendant was picked up; warrant quashed.
Return date on July 20, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Stacy M Deford in court with attorney Mark D. Lawton which appears by telephone.  Defendant Stacy M Deford in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared by telephone for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM168, 15CM135 & 15CM108:
BY THE COURT:  Warrant satisfied; defendant was picked up.

Atty Lawton states that he has had no contact with the defendant.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant states that she has called the COC office numerous times and wasn't told of the court date.
Atty Hendee requests a $500 cash bond on each case.  Atty Lawton asks that a return date be set soon; he has an authorization to appear

BY THE COURT:  Court will reinstate the $250 cash bond for all three cases with the same conditions.
Defendant will need to appear at the next return date.  Return date scheduled for July 20, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Mark D. Lawton in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM108, 15CM135 & 15CM168 tracking:
Atty Hendee states that on 15CM108 the defendant appeared on March 24th in which today's date was sent and given notice.  In speaking with Atty Lawton, he has not had contact with the defendant.    Atty Hendee requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear.  
Atty Lawton states that he has only had the case for about 3 weeks and asks that the warrant be stayed.

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue; stayed for 7 days.

**Defendant appeared in court; warrant quashed.
Cash bond reinstated
Return date on May 19, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Stacy M Deford in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM168, 15CM135 & 15CM108 tracking together:
BY THE COURT: Based on the defendant's appearance today; warrant quashed.

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant states that she has been in and out of the hospital.  Defendant gives a copy of appointments to the court.
Court states that she would have received a notice on January 20th.  Defendant states that yes but it was 2 months ago.

Atty Hendee responds and will leave the bond amount up to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Court will reset the Return Dates; court will reinstate the cash bond on each of the cases.  Return date scheduled for May 19, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM108, 15CM1356 & 15CM168 tracking together:
  Atty Hendee requests warrant on all three cases based on defendant's failure to appear.  

Atty Hendee asks that the cash bonds be forfieted.

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue on all 3 cases.
Cash bonds will be forfieted.

Defendant Stacy M Deford in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM168, 15CM108, 15CM135
Defendant wishes to contact the public defender.
BY THE COURT:  Reset.  Return date scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

with conditions:
*Maintain Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance
*Go through the booking process
Return date at 01-20-2016 03:30 pm

Defendant Stacy M Deford in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM168, 15CM135 and 15CM108 tracking:
Atty Hendee states that the defendant failed to appear last week; warrant was issued and the cash bond was forfieted.  Atty Hendee states that the new case 15CM168; Ms. Deford was served today.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant states that she did not have a ride.  Defendant states that she called the DA's office and left a voicemail.
BY THE COURT:  Warrant quashed.

15CM168:
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Court finds probable cause.
  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Atty Hendee requests an amount of $250.00 cash bond for each case along with absolute sobriety.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.
BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $250.00 cash bond on each of the three cases with conditions
*Maintain Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance
15CM168 - Defendant needs to go through the booking process.

15CM135:
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court finds probable cause.
  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.
  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.

Set all matters for Return.  Return date scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Stacy M Deford not in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM108, 15CM135 and 15CM168 tracking together:
Atty Hendee states that the defendant did not know about 15CM168 was going to be held today; however, she did receive notice of the other hearings.  
  Atty Hendee requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear.  Atty Hendee asks that the cash bond be forfieted.

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue. Cash bond to be forfieted.
